DOCNAME: CASE OF BIELECTRIC S.R.L. v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant company summoned company X to appear before ORG , requesting X to be ordered to carry out all the works and amendments necessary to bring a factory building into compliance with the law and the instructions given by the GPE fire brigade in DATE .

CARDINAL . The preparation of the case for trial began at the hearing of CARDINAL DATE , when the court ordered that an expert opinion be carried out on the factory building and ended at the hearing of DATE , when the parties made their final submissions . The hearing before the court was held on DATE .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , filed with ORG on DATE , ORG held that the construction of the factory building did not constitute a work under a contract ( appalto ) but a sale , and that the factory building was in accordance with all the legal requirements , the alleged defects being aesthetic . It ordered X to replace certain parts in the factory building .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant company lodged an appeal against this judgment before ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP The preparation of the case for trial began at the hearing of DATE and , after a hearing held on DATE , it ended at the hearing of DATE , when the parties made their final submissions . On DATE the applicant company filed written submissions with the court of appeal claiming that the works carried out by company X were in breach of the applicable anti - seismic legislation . The appeal was heard on DATE .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of the same date which was filed with ORG DATE , ORG confirmed that the contract entered into by the parties was a sales contract and not a work contract , and held that the defects in the factory building were merely aesthetic and did not affect the structure . It further held that the applicant company had failed to prove that the failure by X to file the executive plans with ORG had caused any financial prejudice to it and that in any event this issue had not been raised before the first instance .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant company lodged an appeal on points of law before ORG .
CARDINAL . ORG set the public hearing for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE an attempt was made to serve notice of the date of the hearing on the applicant company at the chosen address of its lawyer . However , the latter having in the meantime died , the notification could not be effected . Notice of the date of the hearing was left for the applicant company in ORG on DATE . The applicant company did not learn about the date of the hearing and did not appear before ORG at the hearing of DATE . Nor did company X appear at the hearing . ORG heard addresses from the General Attorney .

CARDINAL . By a judgment delivered on DATE , filed with ORG on DATE , ORG quashed the decision of ORG of CARDINAL DATE only insofar as it related to the refusal to award to the applicant company compensation for the replacement of certain parts of the factory building and referred the matter back before ORG . ORG confirmed the remainder of the appealed judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company resumed proceedings before ORG . CARDINAL hearings were held before it ; the closing hearing was scheduled for DATE .
